result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony Allen Fern was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The Defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge, the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.
The Court orders $50/month payments to the Department.
The Defendant may be eligible for Huber release after serving three (3) months jail.

The Defendant must have no contact with the victim of this matter, or anyone under the age of eighteen (18), with the exception of his child(ren).
The Defendant must refrain from any use or possession of illegal drugs, substances or paraphernalia without a valid prescription; and must maintain Absolute Sobriety.
The Defendant must undergo a sex offender assessment; follow all treatment that may be recommended; engage in therapy regularly;  register as a sex offender and comply with the registry,

timeConds.notes: The Defendant may serve the jail sentence elsewhere at no cost to Burnett County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Certificate of Compliance with Victim Rights

Defendant, Tony Allen Fern, appeared with Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer.  DA WM Norine appeared for the State. No Corrections or updates to the PSI. VRL complied. The State offers recommendations of 6 months feels the conditions are appropriate. Atty Schieffer addresses the Court, doesn't argue the Departments recommendations. The Defendant declines aloq. The Court orders 5 yrs probation, and 6 months conditional jail. undergo sex offer assessment, and treatment and follow all recomm. No Contact, engage in therapy, reg. as a sex offender.   No use or possession of illegal drugs, substances or paraphernalia without a valid prescription.   Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No contact w/people under the age of 18, eval. may serve in polk co at no cost to Burnett Co. Huber after 3 mo jail. $518.00 @ $50/month. provide DNA COC filed by DA.
Sentencing hearing on June 28, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant, Tony Allen Fern, appeared with Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer.  Attorney William Lund Norine appeared for the State. Atty Schieffer addresses the Court RE: NC plea. PLQ filed. VRL complied, the State requests seperate sentencing date. PSI to be ordered. The Court examines Def. understands his constitutional rights, believes the State could find him G beyond a reasonable doubt, facts are accurate in the PC statement. Atty Schieffer went over the PLQ with his client, as to count 1 Def. enters a NC plea, KFV entered. FB for Plea and the Court finds him G. PSI ordered. Bond to continue. No objection for the State.
Plea hearing on April 19, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Defendant, Tony Allen Fern, appeared with Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer.  DA Norine  appeared for the State. Def. to Plead to 3rd degree sexual assault and request a PSI. Plea date to be scheduled.

Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court.  William Lund Norine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties request adjournment. A motion is to be filed by the state within two weeks. Atty Schieffer requests 30 days after that to reply. Final pretrial and tiral date to be set. Scheduling conference to be scheduled. 3 days for a trial.
